H0.text: The ovary is the organ that an oocyte leaves in humans before fertilization occurs soon after.

H1.text: Egg is the structure from which the oocyte leaves, and fertilization occurs soon after in humans.

H2.text: Placenta is the organ from which, in humans, fertilization occurs soon after the oocyte leaves.

H3.text: Testes are the organ from which the oocyte leaves in humans, after which fertilization occurs soon.

A4.text: Fertilisation in humans usually occurs in the ampulla of the fallopian tube.

A5.text: The zygote divides to form a blastocyst and, upon entering the uterus, implants in the endometrium, beginning pregnancy.

A6.text: The secondary oocyte leaves the ruptured follicle and moves out into the peritoneal cavity through the stigma.

A7.text: The oocyte is released from the ovarian follicle during ovulation.
